subject: Sexual Health
title: Bacteria vs Viruses vs Parasites
description: A short lesson to help you apply Bacteria vs Viruses vs Parasites.

hook.text: Not all STIs are the same. Some are caused by bacteria, some by viruses, and some by tiny parasites.

buildup.text: Bacterial STIs like chlamydia and gonorrhea are single-celled organisms that invade human tissue.

discovery.text: Viral STIs like HIV and herpes inject genetic material into cells, hijacking them to make copies.

twist.text: Bacterial STIs can usually be cured with antibiotics. Viral ones often stay in the body for life.

climax.text: Knowing the type of pathogen determines the treatment, the prognosis, and the prevention strategy.

punchline.text: The pathogen type decides the treatment path.

quiz.question: Which type of STI can usually be cured with antibiotics?
